questions.text: A 72-year-old man with a history of chronic heart failure is hospitalized for a severe soft tissue infection. Cultures reveal the presence of methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA). Given the organism's resistance pattern and the patient's need for targeted therapy, which antibiotic is most appropriate to treat infections solely affecting the cell walls of gram-positive bacteria?

A 34-year-old woman presents with a rapidly enlarging neck mass, weight gain, and fatigue. On physical examination, there is a diffuse, non-tender goiter. Laboratory tests reveal elevated TSH and low free T4 levels. A fine needle aspiration biopsy is performed, and the histopathology image is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 62-year-old man with a history of hypertension presents with sudden onset weakness in his left arm and difficulty speaking. He is otherwise alert and oriented. A non-contrast CT scan of the brain is performed. What is the most likely diagnosis based on the CT findings?
In acidosis, most of the hydrogen ions secreted by the proximal tubule are associated with which of the following processes?

A 32-year-old male presents with chronic diarrhea and malabsorption. Laboratory investigations show abnormal stool composition, with increased carbohydrate content suggesting a possible carbohydrate malabsorption disorder. To confirm the presence of carbohydrates in the patient's stool sample, a biochemical test is ordered. Which of the following tests is most appropriate to detect carbohydrates in this case?

A 36-year-old man undergoes a biopsy of the small intestine due to chronic diarrhea. Microscopic analysis of the intestinal mucosa reveals a prominent population of immune cells in the intraepithelial region. Which cell type is most likely predominant in the intraepithelial region of the intestine?

A healthcare worker in a neonatal intensive care unit has been identified with MRSA colonization in her nasal passages during an outbreak investigation. Which treatment is most appropriate for decolonization?

35-year-old woman presents with daily high-grade fever, sore throat, and joint pain for the past 2 weeks. She also reports a salmon-colored rash that comes and goes with the fevers. Laboratory tests show elevated ferritin, leukocytosis, and mildly elevated liver enzymes. Blood cultures and autoimmune serologies are negative. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A family planning clinic is evaluating the side effects and complications associated with various intrauterine devices (IUDs). Which of the following statements correctly matches the IUD with its associated characteristic?

options.label: A
options.text: Lippes Loop has the lowest expulsion rate

options.label: B
options.text: LNG-IUD has the lowest pregnancy rate

options.label: C
options.text: Progestasert has the highest removal rate

options.label: D
options.text: LNG-IUD has the highest pregnancy rate

questions.correct_answer: B. LNG-IUD has the lowest pregnancy rate
questions.explanation: Ans. B) LNG-IUD has the lowest pregnancy rate

questions.text: A neurologist is optimizing the treatment plan for a patient with Parkinson’s disease who is already on levodopa. The goal is to enhance the bioavailability of levodopa to improve symptom control. Which of the following agents is specifically used to increase levodopa bioavailability by inhibiting its peripheral breakdown?

A 45-year-old man with a history of HIV presents with worsening cognitive function, memory loss, and motor deficits. Imaging shows diffuse cerebral atrophy. Postmortem brain examination reveals the presence of multinucleated giant cells in the cerebral parenchyma. The formation of these giant cells is due to the fusion of which of the following cell types?

A patient presents with an inflamed throat, as shown in the image. A culture from the lesion demonstrates organisms that have branching with narrowed ends. Based on this microscopic finding, what is the most likely diagnosis?
A developing embryo undergoes physiological apoptosis during organogenesis. Which of the following mechanisms is responsible for clearing apoptotic cells without causing inflammation?
A 25-year-old woman, G3P2, presents with a history of heavy vaginal bleeding, passage of tissue and a history suggestive of complete abortion. What is the most likely finding on ultrasound?

options.label: A
options.text: Blood clots in the endometrial cavity

options.label: C
options.text: Heteroechoic contents seen in the uterine cavity

options.label: D
options.text: The gestational sac seen low down in the uterine cavity

questions.text: A patient with fever, cough, and recent hotel stay has negative sputum cultures on standard media. The lab recommends a specialized medium for Legionella pneumophila. Which medium is used?
questions.correct_answer: C. Buffered charcoal yeast extract (BCYE) agar

questions.text: A 54-year-old female undergoing chemotherapy for breast cancer is prescribed daunorubicin as part of her treatment regimen. To mitigate the risk of cardiotoxicity associated with daunorubicin, her oncologist plans to administer an additional medication. Which drug is specifically used to prevent cardiotoxicity induced by daunorubicin?

A 3-year-old child presents with a mild rash and thrombocytopenia two weeks after receiving a routine vaccination. The pediatrician considers a possible vaccine-related cause. Which of the following vaccines is most likely associated with the development of thrombocytopenia?

A 57-year-old male patient, undergoing treatment for both chronic migraine and cardiac arrhythmias, undergoes a routine chest X-ray which shows evidence of pleural thickening. Given the treatments typically used for his conditions, which of the following medications might be responsible for this complication?

In a volunteer, 10 grams of mannitol was injected into the venous blood. At equilibrium, the urinary excretion of mannitol was found to be 10% and the plasma concentration of mannitol was measured at 60 mg/dl. Calculate the extracellular fluid (ECF) volume based on this information.

A tropical medicine researcher is studying the factors that contribute to malaria transmission in a rural community. To assess the risk, they are focusing on certain vector-related indices. Which of the following are included in the Malaria Vector Indices? Human blood index Biting density Slide positivity rate Inoculation rate

A 35-year-old man presents with dark, streak-like hyperpigmentation on his neck and chest after using a new perfume and spending time outdoors. He denies any pain or itching but is concerned about the pigmentation. Which of the following is the most likely cause of his condition?

A 32-year-old male, post-op day 4 following open reduction and internal fixation (ORIF), develops fever and redness around the surgical site. There is purulent discharge from the wound with surrounding erythema. Wound culture reveals gram-positive cocci in clusters. Treatment with oral dicloxacillin is started, but the patient shows no signs of improvement. Which characteristic of the infecting organism most likely explains the failure of antibiotic therapy?

options.label: A
options.text: Presence of an impenetrable outer membrane

questions.text: A mother brings her 1-day old newborn baby to the pediatric emergency with a referral letter from the PHC mentioning the diagnosis of a congenital heart disease. On examination, cyanosis was noted and echo findings were suggestive of a cyanotic heart disease, which is found to be duct dependent heart disease. All of the following are duct dependent cyanotic heart diseases except?

options.label: D
options.text: Tetralogy of Fallot with Pulmonary atresia

questions.text: A 34-year-old woman at 32 weeks of gestation presents to the clinic for a routine prenatal visit. She has a history of chronic hypertension and was diagnosed with preeclampsia earlier in this pregnancy. On ultrasound, the abdominal circumference is measured to be less than the 10th percentile for gestational age. A non-stress test reveals late decelerations. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the fetus's growth restriction and distress?
Which of the following scales or nomograms is used to assess the risk of acetaminophen (paracetamol) toxicity and guide treatment with N-acetylcysteine?

A physician is counseling a patient who is interested in quitting smoking and discussing the pharmacological options available to support this effort. Among the following choices, which is not typically used as a medication for smoking cessation?

A dermatologist evaluates a patient who returned from a tropical vacation with severe itching and lesions on the feet. After examining the affected areas and considering the patient's recent travel history, the physician suspects tungiasis. What type of infection is tungiasis?

A 28-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after being bitten by an elapidae snake while hiking in a rural area. Initially, he was stable but soon began experiencing symptoms. What is the most characteristic feature of envenomation by this type of snake?

A 29-year-old woman visits the clinic complaining of double vision that has been progressively worsening over the past few weeks. During the eye examination, it is noted that she has difficulty moving both eyes inward (limited adduction), and when she tries to look sideways, there is a fine jerking movement of the eye (nystagmus). Additionally, her right pupil shows a delayed response to light compared to the left. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient being treated with lithium for bipolar disorder is brought to the emergency room with slurred speech, ataxia, and polyuria. His renal function is impaired. Which of the following electrolyte imbalances might have precipitated this condition?
Which of the following is not true about breast milk?
Which of the following conditions normally cause arteriolar vasodilation during exercise?

A 68-year-old man is incidentally found to have an elevated serum protein level during routine blood work. Further testing reveals a monoclonal spike (M-spike) on serum protein electrophoresis. He has no symptoms, normal calcium levels, normal renal function, no anemia, and no lytic bone lesions. Bone marrow biopsy shows <10% clonal plasma cells. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: C. Monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance (MGUS)

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman presents to the gynecology clinic for follow-up after an abnormal Pap smear showing high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion (HSIL). The gynecologist explains that she needs a procedure to remove abnormal tissue from the cervix for further evaluation. Which of the following is the technique depicted in the image that would best address her condition?
Which of the following statements about decelerations is false?

options.label: B
options.text: Starts after peak of uterine contraction and ends after uterine contraction ends

options.label: C
options.text: At least 10 beats, 2 times in a 20 min period above baseline

questions.correct_answer: C. At least 10 beats, 2 times in a 20 min period above baseline
questions.explanation: Ans. C) At least 10 beats, 2 times in a 20 min period above baseline

questions.text: A 50-year-old man presents to the emergency department with a severe headache described as "the worst headache of his life." He also reports neck stiffness and nausea. A CT scan of the head reveals subarachnoid hemorrhage. After stabilization, further imaging shows an aneurysm at the bifurcation of the anterior communicating artery. What is the most likely structural defect leading to this type of aneurysm?

options.label: A
options.text: Endothelial injury of the vessel due to hypertension

questions.correct_answer: C. Arterial internal elastic lamina defect

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman with a history of chronic hypertension presents for her first prenatal visit at 12 weeks of gestation. Given her risk factors, she is concerned about developing pre-eclampsia during her pregnancy. Based on WHO recommendations, which supplementation is advised to reduce her risk of developing pre-eclampsia?

A 72-year-old patient presents with chronic heart failure and previous episodes of severe hypokalemia is under evaluation for an appropriate diuretic therapy. Given the need to prevent further potassium loss, which of the following diuretics should be avoided?

A 35-year-old woman with symptomatic uterine fibroids is scheduled for surgery. During the procedure, the surgeon uses the instrument shown in the image. What procedure is this instrument most commonly used for?

A 45-year-old man with a history of chronic alcohol use is brought to the emergency room by his family due to agitation, confusion, and aggressive behavior. His family members report that he has not eaten much in the past few days. On examination, he is disoriented, and his blood glucose level is measured at 41 mg/dL. Which of the following biochemical processes is most likely responsible for his hypoglycemia?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased conversion of pyruvate to oxaloacetate

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman, P2L2, presents with mild, dull, aching abdominal pain. Her last menstrual period (LMP) was 3 weeks ago. A pelvic ultrasound reveals a 5 cm simple cyst in the right ovary. What is the most appropriate next step in management?

A 45-year-old male presents with difficulty in urinating and a history of trauma to the perineal area. He reports a weak urine stream and occasional pain during urination. An imaging study is performed. What is the name of the investigation?

A 30-year-old healthcare worker presents after a needle stick injury from a patient known to be seropositive for hepatitis B. Her serum studies reveal negative results for hepatitis B surface antigen, hepatitis B surface antibody, and hepatitis C antibody. What is the next best step in her management?

options.label: B
options.text: Revaccinate with two doses of hepatitis B vaccine

options.label: C
options.text: Revaccinate with a 3-dose regimen of hepatitis B vaccine

options.label: D
options.text: Administer hepatitis B immunoglobulin and begin a new 3-dose regimen of hepatitis B vaccine

questions.correct_answer: D. Administer hepatitis B immunoglobulin and begin a new 3-dose regimen of hepatitis B vaccine

questions.text: A 40-year-old male is posted for an emergency laparotomy. His abdominal X-ray is shown below. Which of these agents will you avoid?
Drug of choice for treatment of hypothyroidism in first trimester of pregnancy is?

A 45-year-old female patient presents with high grade fever, jaundice and right upper abdominal pain. She has been suffering from intermittent episodes of pain in the past few months, typically after meals rich in fat. An imaging revealed a stone in the common bile duct with dilated bile duct and biliary radicles. What is the likely complication she is suffering from?

You saw a child who runs well and can climb upstairs and downstairs with one step at a time, you remembered that your pediatric teacher yesterday explained about the development of milestones. When is the next milestone of climbing steps with alternate feet expected to be developed?

A 6-year-old boy is brought to the clinic due to developmental delay, hypotonia, and fragile, kinky hair. The parents report that the child frequently has episodes of joint dislocations and has unusually elastic skin. Physical examination shows loose skin, hypermobile joints, and sparse, brittle hair. Laboratory tests reveal low serum copper and ceruloplasmin levels. Which of the following enzymes is most likely responsible for this patient’s presentation?

Which will be the ideal treatment for closed displaced fracture of lower third of fibula with fracture of medial malleolus. Sharp ends were seen at fracture site with soft tissue swelling of leg on X-ray:

options.label: C
options.text: Neurological Assessment – closed Reduction and again check Neurological Assessment – analgesic – cast

questions.correct_answer: C. Neurological Assessment – closed Reduction and again check Neurological Assessment – analgesic – cast
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Neurological Assessment – closed Reduction and again check Neurological Assessment – analgesic – cast

questions.text: A mental health policy analyst is evaluating the key components of the Mental Health Act 2017, which aligns with global standards set by the WHO's Mental Health Action Gap Program (MHAGP). The analyst is tasked with identifying which of the following is not emphasized under the provisions of the Mental Health Act 2017?

options.label: A
options.text: Protection against involuntary admission without due process

options.label: B
options.text: Integration of mental health services into primary healthcare

options.label: C
options.text: Mandatory screening for mental disorders in school children

questions.correct_answer: C. Mandatory screening for mental disorders in school children
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Mandatory screening for mental disorders in school children

questions.text: A 39-year-old previously healthy male was hospitalized for 2 weeks with epigastric pain radiating to his back, nausea, and vomiting. Initial laboratory values revealed an elevated amylase level. Five weeks following discharge, he complains of early satiety, epigastric pain, and fullness. His serum amylase level is normal. He undergoes a CT scan demonstrating a 6 cm by 6 cm rim-enhancing fluid collection in the body of the pancreas. Which of these is the likely diagnosis?

A 56-year-old woman with history of pathological fracture of neck of femur. She has elevated ALP and N – Telopeptide. Her DEXA scan confirmed a diagnosis of osteoporosis. Which of the following would be raised?

A 25-year-old patient is diagnosed with acute meningococcal meningitis. During the course of the illness, the patient develops several ophthalmic complications. Which of the following ophthalmic manifestations is least likely to be due to acute meningococcal meningitis?

A 56-year-old man presents to the emergency department with sudden onset of chest pain radiating to his left arm and jaw. His medical history includes hypertension and smoking. An ECG shows ST-segment elevation in leads V3 and V4. Coronary angiography reveals an obstruction in the vessel that supplies the anterolateral wall of the left ventricle, specifically affecting a branch of the left anterior descending artery. Which artery is most likely involved in this patient’s condition?
A patient is undergoing an eye examination using the specialized glasses shown in the image. What condition are these glasses primarily used to detect?

A clinical researcher is conducting a study on the thermal comfort of patients in a hospital ward. To evaluate the average temperature from all surfaces surrounding the patients, which instrument should the researcher use?

A 35-year-old male presents with chronic abdominal pain, weight loss, and episodes of diarrhea over the past few months. He also reports a history of low-grade fever and night sweats. A barium study of the abdomen is performed, showing the "pulled up cecum" sign and widening of the ileocecal angle. Which condition is most likely responsible for these findings?
Identify the type of hearing loss based on the below audiogram:

A 28-year-old woman is admitted with severe muscle rigidity, hyperthermia, and altered consciousness after being treated with haloperidol for her psychotic episode. Which neurotransmitter dysregulation is most likely implicated in her current condition?
A patient with symptoms of psychosis is prescribed aripiprazole. Which of the following best describes this drug, when compared to other antipsychotic drugs?

options.label: A
options.text: No intrinsic activity, high affinity for D2 receptors, less extra-pyramidal symptoms and more weight gain

options.label: B
options.text: High intrinsic activity, no affinity for D2 receptor, more extra-pyramidal symptoms and less weight gain

options.label: C
options.text: High intrinsic activity, low affinity for D2 receptor, less extrapyramidal symptoms and less weight gain

options.label: D
options.text: Low intrinsic activity, high affinity for D2 receptor, less extra-pyramidal symptoms and less weight gain

questions.correct_answer: D. Low intrinsic activity, high affinity for D2 receptor, less extra-pyramidal symptoms and less weight gain
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Low intrinsic activity, high affinity for D2 receptor, less extra-pyramidal symptoms and less weight gain

questions.text: Identify the pathology shown in the image in a diabetic patient.
A man inspires 1000 ml from a spirometer. The intrapleural pressure was −4 cm H2O before inspiration and −12 cm H2O at the end of inspiration. What is the compliance of the lungs?

A mother brings her 17-month-old child to the doctor for routine eye checkup. On examination the Doctor notices a thinned-out cornea. On asking history, the child has a history of iron deficiency anemia. The weight of the child is 10kg, what should be the dose of vitamin A to be given in this child of based on the age?
What is the management of Intraperitoneal bladder rupture?

options.label: C
options.text: Simple catheter drainage is the treatment

questions.text: A 35-year-old male presents to the emergency department after a blunt trauma to the perineal region sustained while straddling a bicycle. He is experiencing swelling and bruising in the perineum and scrotum, and physical examination reveals blood pooling in the area. There is suspicion of a rupture of the penile urethra. In this scenario, extravasation of blood is least likely to extend into which of the following spaces?
Match the following clinical findings with their diagnosis.
Which of the following is true about hemorrhoids?

options.label: A
options.text: Internal hemorrhoids are palpable on P/R exam

options.label: B
options.text: External hemorrhoids are proximal to dentate line

options.label: C
options.text: Internal hemorrhoids bleed profusely and are painless

options.label: D
options.text: Internal hemorrhoids are covered by anoderm

questions.correct_answer: C. Internal hemorrhoids bleed profusely and are painless

questions.text: A 35-year-old man presents for evaluation after receiving multiple vaccinations. A laboratory test is performed to assess his immune response, specifically focusing on the presence of memory T cells that are responsible for long-term immunity. Which of the following markers is most likely used to identify memory T cells?

32-year-old woman presents with progressive dyspnea and recurrent pneumothoraces. She has a history of tuberous sclerosis. CT of the chest shows multiple thin-walled cysts, and abdominal imaging reveals bilateral angiomyolipomas in the kidneys. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 34-year-old woman presents with continuous urinary leakage for 3 months following a difficult vaginal delivery. She denies dysuria, hematuria, or pain. A pelvic examination reveals no visible abnormalities, but there is continuous urine leakage observed through the vagina. The physician suspects a vesicovaginal fistula (VVF). What is the best diagnostic test to confirm the diagnosis?
A pediatrician is evaluating which of her patients would benefit most from the pneumococcal vaccine. Among the following groups, who is the primary candidate for vaccination?

options.label: B
options.text: A patient with sickle cell anemia

options.label: C
options.text: A patient with recurrent otitis media and sinusitis

questions.correct_answer: B. A patient with sickle cell anemia

questions.text: A clinician is evaluating a patient with a suspected case of dengue who has a history of a previous dengue infection. The patient presents with severe symptoms. What mechanism is likely contributing to the increased severity of the patient's current dengue infection?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased viral load with subsequent infections

options.label: B
options.text: Enhanced immune response due to prior sensitization

options.label: C
options.text: Antibody-dependent enhancement (ADE) of viral entry into cells

questions.correct_answer: C. Antibody-dependent enhancement (ADE) of viral entry into cells

questions.text: A 54-year-old male, following binge drinking and heavy meals, was brought to the emergency with sudden onset of severe left sided chest pain radiating to the left shoulder. On examination, subcutaneous emphysema was noted over chest. Pneumomediastinum was present on X ray. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 62-year-old male presents to the clinic with symptoms of overactive bladder, including frequent urination, urgency, and incontinence. His physician prescribes tolterodine to help manage these symptoms. Which of the following best describes the type of receptor that tolterodine primarily acts on?

A 29-year-old pregnant woman with a history of mechanical heart valve replacement presents during her first trimester. She has a history of warfarin use and was informed of potential risks of warfarin embryopathy. Given her condition, what is the best management strategy at this stage of her pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: Replace warfarin with heparin in the first trimester

options.label: C
options.text: Switch to low molecular weight (LMW) heparin

questions.correct_answer: A. Replace warfarin with heparin in the first trimester
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Replace warfarin with heparin in the first trimester

questions.text: A 55-year-old patient underwent hysterectomy 2 years back, now presented with colicky abdominal pain and bilious vomiting. On examination, abdomen was tender with exaggerated bowel sounds. On investigations, multiple air fluid levels were seen in the abdomen. What is the next step?

A baby was recently delivered in the labor room. The mother was found to have diabetes. After the delivery of the infant of diabetic mother, blood glucose of the infant was measured to be 60 mg/dl. What other investigation does the sister expect that the physician would ask her to do next?

A 27-year-old male presents with a history of easy bruising and frequent nosebleeds. Physical examination is unremarkable. Laboratory investigations reveal a platelet count of 200,000/mm³, partial thromboplastin time (PTT) of 48 seconds, prothrombin time (PT) of 12.5 seconds, and reduced ristocetin-induced platelet aggregation. Further studies indicate normal levels of clotting factors. Which of the following molecular processes is most likely impaired in this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Binding between von Willebrand factor and platelet glycoproteins

options.label: D
options.text: Formation of cross-linked fibrin polymers by factor XIII

questions.correct_answer: C. Binding between von Willebrand factor and platelet glycoproteins

questions.text: A public health team is responding to a disaster-affected area where there has been significant ecological disruption and a high number of injuries. In the post-disaster phase, which of the following is the most practical and effective strategy for disease prevention and control?

options.label: B
options.text: Supplying safe drinking water and proper disposal of excreta

questions.correct_answer: B. Supplying safe drinking water and proper disposal of excreta
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Supplying safe drinking water and proper disposal of excreta

questions.text: During a clinical review session, a pharmacology resident discusses the significance of the CYP450 enzyme system in drug metabolism. The resident points out that one enzyme subtype is particularly influential in the metabolism of a broad array of medications including immunosuppressants and cholesterol-lowering agents. Which CYP450 enzyme is crucial for metabolizing drugs such as cyclosporine, tacrolimus, and several types of statins?
Which of the following correctly describes a country in Phase IV of the demographic cycle?

options.label: A
options.text: High birth rate, high death rate, pyramidal age pyramid

options.label: B
options.text: Low birth rate, low death rate, cylindrical age pyramid

options.label: C
options.text: High birth rate, declining death rate, increasing dependency ratio

options.label: D
options.text: Declining birth rate, declining death rate, reversal in population growth

questions.correct_answer: B. Low birth rate, low death rate, cylindrical age pyramid
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Low birth rate, low death rate, cylindrical age pyramid

questions.text: A 35-year-old scuba diver presents to the clinic with a painful wound on his leg, which he sustained while brushing against coral during a dive. The area is red, swollen, and slightly warm to the touch. The physician suspects a bacterial infection commonly associated with coral cuts. Which organism is most likely responsible for this infection?

A 50 kg patient is treated with a drug at a dose of 40 mg/kg orally. The drug exhibits a half-life of 10 hours, and the initial plasma concentration is measured at 2.0 mg/mL. Given these pharmacokinetic properties, which statement accurately describes the drug's elimination characteristics?

options.label: A
options.text: Volume of distribution (Vd) of this drug is 20 L.

options.label: B
options.text: Clearance (CL) is relatively high at 30 liters/hour.

options.label: C
options.text: The elimination constant (k) is calculated to be 0.069 per hour.

options.label: D
options.text: Bioavailability of the given drug is 100 percent

questions.correct_answer: C. The elimination constant (k) is calculated to be 0.069 per hour.

questions.text: A 45-year-old male undergoes thyroidectomy for a multinodular goiter. Postoperatively, he develops hoarseness of voice and difficulty projecting his voice. Examination reveals a weakened ability to tense the vocal cords. Injury to which of the following nerves is most likely responsible for his symptoms?

A 55-year-old postmenopausal woman presents with vaginal bleeding. She reports that her last menstrual period was 6 years ago. There is no associated pain, and she has no history of hormone replacement therapy. What is the most appropriate next step in the evaluation of her postmenopausal bleeding?

A nephrologist is managing a patient with chronic kidney disease who has recently developed moderate anemia. The physician is considering a new treatment approach that enhances erythropoietin production by simulating the physiological effects observed at high altitudes. Which of the following is oral drug used for this purpose?

A 45-year-old female presents with a painless, slow-growing mass on her abdominal wall. She reports that the mass has progressively enlarged over the past several months. The patient denies any significant trauma or infection at the site, though she did have a cesarean section 2 years ago. On physical examination, a firm, immobile mass measuring approximately 10 cm in diameter is palpated on the lower right abdominal quadrant. A biopsy of the mass reveals bland spindle cells with a collagenous stroma. Which of the following is the underlying pathology in this patient's condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Exuberant proliferation of fibroblasts and collagen

questions.correct_answer: A. Exuberant proliferation of fibroblasts and collagen

questions.text: What is this hernia known as?

A 56-year-old woman presents with a 4-cm squamous cell carcinoma of the vulva, which involves the urethral meatus. Her medical history is significant for systemic lupus erythematosus. What is the most appropriate treatment for her condition?

options.label: C
options.text: Radical vulvectomy with bilateral inguinofemoral lymph node dissection

questions.correct_answer: C. Radical vulvectomy with bilateral inguinofemoral lymph node dissection
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Radical vulvectomy with bilateral inguinofemoral lymph node dissection

questions.text: Match the following cardiological conditions in children with their typical chest X-ray findings.

A 35-year-old woman with a history of previous right thyroidectomy for a benign thyroid nodule now undergoes completion thyroidectomy for a suspicious thyroid mass. Several hours postoperatively, she develops progressive swelling under the incision, stridor, and difficulty breathing. Orotracheal intubation is successful. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step?

options.label: A
options.text: Fiberoptic laryngoscopy to rule out bilateral vocal cord paralysis

questions.text: A 5-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with lethargy, vomiting, and confusion. His blood ammonia level is significantly elevated. Further evaluation reveals a defect in a key enzyme involved in ammonia detoxification. Which of the following biological processes utilizes carbamoyl phosphate synthetase I, the enzyme likely deficient in this patient?

A 40-year-old man presents with difficulty in finger movement after a hand injury. Upon examination, it is noted that abduction of the fingers is impaired. You note that one of the fingers, which can abduct in both directions, has two dorsal interossei muscles. Which of the following fingers has two dorsal interossei muscles?
Calculate the ejection fraction from the given diagram:
Which of the following indices does not include height in its calculation?

A 45-year-old patient complains of recurrent swelling in one side of the neck. She is afraid of eating food as it worsens the swelling. Imaging was performed and shown below. What is the affected organ?

A 68-year-old male patient comes to the clinic complaining of worsening vision, particularly in low light conditions, and experiencing glare while driving at night. He had cataract surgery 4 months ago and initially had good vision after the procedure. On slit-lamp examination, the image shown is observed. What is the most likely cause of his symptoms?
Which of the following biochemical functions is most directly related to the role of HDL in cholesterol metabolism?

options.label: A
options.text: Conversion of cholesterol to bile acids

options.label: C
options.text: Transfer of cholesterol from peripheral tissues to the liver

options.label: D
options.text: Hydrolysis of triglycerides in adipose tissue

questions.correct_answer: C. Transfer of cholesterol from peripheral tissues to the liver

questions.text: A 68-year-old man with a history of smoking, systemic hypertension, and emphysema presents to the emergency department with facial swelling and congestion of his head, neck, and upper extremities. His vitals are stable, but on examination, there is prominent venous distention in the upper body. He has smoked for the past 20 years. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 58-year-old male presents with chest pain that worsens when lying down and improves when sitting up or leaning forward. He describes the pain as sharp and constant. He had a myocardial infarction 6 months ago and was treated with a stent. A week ago, he recovered from a viral upper respiratory infection. On physical examination, there is a faint friction rub heard over the left side of the chest. Below is his ECG. What is the most likely cause of this patient's chest pain?

A 28-year-old woman has noticed an asymmetry in her neck, which becomes more pronounced when she tenses the skin of her lower face and neck. Upon physical examination, an asymmetry is seen in the neck muscles when she tightens the skin of her neck, indicating a possible developmental abnormality. This asymmetry is most likely related to a limited mesodermal migration during development, specifically affecting which of the following embryonic structures?

A 58-year-old man presents to the clinic with a history of frequent falls and difficulty with balance, especially when walking. Upon examination, he displays unsteady gait and mild tremor. A lesion is suspected in the cerebellum (see the blue mark). The fibers from this marked region primarily terminate in which of the following structures?

A public health researcher is evaluating a community health program to determine how well it achieves its intended outcomes when implemented in a real-world setting. What is the term used to describe the extent to which this intervention does what it is intended to do in a community population?

A 65-year-old male with no significant medical history collapses suddenly while jogging. Emergency medical services arrive, and he is found to be in cardiac arrest with a blood pressure of 50/20 mm Hg. ECG shows ventricular tachycardia with an irregular rhythm. Three defibrillation attempts are made, and the patient receives 1 mg IV epinephrine, but he remains pulseless, with his blood pressure increasing to 60/35 mm Hg. What is the most appropriate next step in management?

A 50-year-old male with a history of chronic alcohol use presents with acute dull abdominal pain. He has been on antiretroviral therapy (ART) for HIV management for several years. Laboratory investigations reveal significantly elevated serum lipase levels. Given his history and the current clinical findings, which of the following medications is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?
Which of these is not true regarding Succinylcholine?

options.label: B
options.text: Requires Neostigmine for reversal of action

questions.correct_answer: B. Requires Neostigmine for reversal of action
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Requires Neostigmine for reversal of action

questions.text: A public health official is tasked with assessing the effectiveness of an Iodine Deficiency Disorders (IDD) control program. Which of the following is considered the best indicator for monitoring the impact of this program?

options.label: A
options.text: Prevalence of goiter among school children

options.label: B
options.text: Urinary iodine levels among pregnant women

questions.correct_answer: B. Urinary iodine levels among pregnant women

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman presents with chronic pelvic pain, weight loss, and infertility. She reports a history of recurrent episodes of pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) and recent travel to an endemic region. A diagnostic laparoscopy reveals fallopian tubes with a characteristic "tobacco pouch" appearance, where the tubes are distended, with caseating granulomas noted on biopsy. What is the most likely diagnosis?

50-year-old male presents with nausea and vomiting for the past 2 days. He has a history of well-controlled hypertension and reports recent weight loss, headaches, fatigue, and a chronic cough lasting for 2 years. He has a 20-year history of smoking 2 packs per day. Physical examination reveals generalized weakness with no signs of peripheral edema, and routine blood tests show hyponatremia. What is the most likely finding in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Positive TTF-1 and mucin staining in lung biopsy

options.label: B
options.text: Presence of ALK or EGFR mutations

options.label: C
options.text: Keratin pearls and intercellular bridges on histology

options.label: D
options.text: Chromogranin positive mass in the lung

questions.correct_answer: D. Chromogranin positive mass in the lung

questions.text: A 40-year-old male patient presents with the visual phenomenon shown in the image. He reports that these symptoms have been progressively worsening. Which of the following is the least likely cause of this symptom?

A 34-year-old patient with a history of focal seizures is being evaluated for suspected mesial temporal sclerosis. An MRI is ordered to assess for hippocampal atrophy. The radiologist requests the optimal imaging plane for accurately visualizing the hippocampus. Which of the following imaging planes will best evaluate the hippocampus in this patient?

The clinical laboratory returned the following values for arterial blood taken from a patient: plasma pH = 7.28, plasma HCO3 − = 32 mEq/L, and plasma PCO2 = 70 mm Hg. What is this patient’s acid–base disorder?

options.label: A
options.text: Acute respiratory acidosis without renal compensation

options.label: B
options.text: Respiratory acidosis with partial renal compensation

options.label: C
options.text: Acute metabolic acidosis without respiratory compensation

options.label: D
options.text: Metabolic acidosis with partial respiratory compensation

questions.correct_answer: B. Respiratory acidosis with partial renal compensation
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Respiratory acidosis with partial renal compensation

questions.text: A 45-year-old male patient is being evaluated for venous insufficiency. Imaging of the thoracic venous system is performed, and an abnormal dilation of the azygos vein is noted. Which of the following structures does the azygos vein develop from?
A 68-year-old male presents with tense bullae on his skin as shown below. Tzanck smear shows no acantholysis. What histological finding is most likely to be observed in the lesions?
The volume–pressure curves shown in the diagram were obtained from a young, healthy subject and a patient. Which of the following best describes the condition of the patient?
A patient with excoriation disorder is likely to engage in repetitive skin-picking behavior for which of the following reasons?

options.label: A
options.text: To relieve a sensation of itching or discomfort

options.label: B
options.text: Due to hallucinations instructing her to pick

options.label: C
options.text: As a means to enhance appearance

options.label: D
options.text: To avoid anxiety related to contamination

questions.correct_answer: A. To relieve a sensation of itching or discomfort
questions.explanation: Ans. A) To relieve a sensation of itching or discomfort

questions.text: A 52-year-old male reports recurrent episodes of fainting, particularly triggered by certain neck movements or when tightening his necktie. He has no other significant medical history. Physical and cardiac examinations do not reveal any abnormalities. To establish a definitive diagnosis, which of the following tests should be performed?
questions.correct_answer: B. Carotid massage with ECG monitoring

questions.text: Based on the characteristics of the insect shown in the image, which of the following statements is true about its reproduction?

options.label: A
options.text: Lays single egg outside the body

options.label: B
options.text: Lays clusters of eggs outside the body

questions.correct_answer: C. Gives birth to single larva

questions.text: A 39-year-old man undergoes an intercostal nerve block for pain management after sustaining a rib fracture in a motor vehicle collision. Shortly after the administration of the local anesthetic, he becomes unresponsive with signs of seizures. He is promptly intubated and stabilized. Identify the condition and the initial treatment of choice?
questions.correct_answer: A. Intravenous infusion of 20% intralipid emulsion
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Intravenous infusion of 20% intralipid emulsion

questions.text: 55-year-old woman presents with headache, vomiting, confusion, and irritability after recently skiing at a high altitude. She is tachypneic with a respiratory rate of 31/min and an O2 saturation of 85% on room air. Arterial blood gas (ABG) shows a pH of 7.57, PO2 of 47 mm Hg, PCO2 of 27 mm Hg, and HCO3- of 21 mEq/L. Which medication’s mechanism is most beneficial in managing her condition?

options.label: C
options.text: Inhibits NaCl reabsorption in the distal tubule

options.label: D
options.text: Prevents HCO3- reclamation in the proximal tubule

questions.correct_answer: D. Prevents HCO3- reclamation in the proximal tubule

questions.text: What complication is least likely to occur after the surgery shown below?

Match the following viruses with their associated histopathological features: Column A Molluscum contagiosum BK polyoma virus HPV CMV Column B Henderson-Paterson bodies Owl’s eye inclusion Decoy cells Koilocytes

For a sensory nerve fiber that is connected to a Pacinian corpuscle located on palmar surface of the right hand, the synaptic connection with the subsequent neuron in the corresponding sensory pathway is located in:

options.label: C
options.text: The dorsal horn of the right side of the spinal cord

options.label: D
options.text: The dorsal horn of the left side of the spinal cord

questions.correct_answer: A. The right dorsal column nucleus
questions.explanation: Ans. A) The right dorsal column nucleus

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman presents with vaginal spotting and mild lower abdominal pain. Her last menstrual period was 6 weeks ago. A transvaginal ultrasound is performed, and the image is given below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient has sustained a pelvic fracture in an RTA and is bleeding and is in shock. Immediate management for this case should be?

options.label: D
options.text: Tie a bed sheet around the pelvis

questions.correct_answer: D. Tie a bed sheet around the pelvis
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Tie a bed sheet around the pelvis

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman who has been on combined oral contraceptive pills for the past 6 months presents with complaints of missed periods. She reports regular compliance with the medication and denies any other symptoms such as abdominal pain or unusual bleeding. What is the most appropriate next step in her management?

options.label: D
options.text: Reassure that it is normal to have delayed periods

questions.text: When assessing the characteristics of superantigens and their impact on immune response, which of the following statements is not true about superantigens?

options.label: B
options.text: They result in the release of large amounts of cytokines.

options.label: C
options.text: They bind to TCRβ and class II MHC molecules.

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy presents with nasal obstruction and difficulty breathing through his nose. Examination reveals a unilateral nasal mass that is pale and soft, extending from the nasal cavity into the nasopharynx. The patient also reports recurrent sinus infections but denies any history of allergies. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 47-year-old animal processing worker presents with a sudden onset of fever, chest discomfort, and a dry cough. He is tachycardic and a chest X-ray shows a widened mediastinum. Considering his occupational exposure, what is the most likely causative organism?
Find the false statement among the following regarding canal wall up and canal wall down procedures:

options.label: A
options.text: Canal wall down procedure requires dependence on the doctor for cleaning the mastoid cavity once or twice a year.

options.label: B
options.text: Canal wall up procedure has a low rate of recurrence or residual cholesteatoma and is thus considered a safe procedure.

options.label: C
options.text: In a canal wall down procedure, fitting a hearing aid can be problematic due to a large meatus and mastoid cavity.

options.label: D
options.text: Canal wall up procedure requires a second look surgery after 6 months to rule out residual cholesteatoma.

questions.correct_answer: B. Canal wall up procedure has a low rate of recurrence or residual cholesteatoma and is thus considered a safe procedure.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Canal wall up procedure has a low rate of recurrence or residual cholesteatoma and is thus considered a safe procedure.

questions.text: A healthcare administrator is conducting an evaluation of a new patient care program to determine its success and areas for improvement. The administrator considers various elements of evaluation to ensure a comprehensive assessment. Which of the following is not considered an element of evaluation?

A 5-year-old boy presents to the clinic with developmental delay, recurrent vomiting, and dark-colored urine. His parents report that his urine emits a strong odor. Laboratory investigations reveal elevated levels of tyrosine and its metabolites in the urine. Genetic testing identifies a missense mutation in the gene encoding for 4-hydroxyphenylpyruvate dioxygenase (4-HPPD). Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A resident is analyzing a peripheral blood smear from a patient suspected of having malaria. Schizonts are generally visible in the smears for most Plasmodium species. For which of the following types of malaria are schizonts typically not seen in the peripheral blood smear?

During a school health check, a pediatric pulmonologist analyzes the Peak Expiratory Flow Rate (PEFR) for a cohort of 12-year-old boys, where the PEFR values are normally distributed. The recorded data show an average PEFR of 320 L/min with a standard deviation of 25 L/min. Which of the following statements is most accurate based on the distribution of the PEFR values for these boys?

options.label: A
options.text: Approximately 95% of the boys have PEFR values between 270 and 370 L/min.

options.label: B
options.text: The measurements confirm that all boys in the cohort have optimal lung function.

options.label: C
options.text: Roughly 5% of the boys have PEFR values below 270 L/min.

questions.correct_answer: A. Approximately 95% of the boys have PEFR values between 270 and 370 L/min.

questions.text: Most common indication for liver transplantation in children is:

A 32-year-old male presents with red, scaly and itchy lesions on the soles of his feet for the past two months. He works as a lifeguard and spends prolonged periods in damp environments. Skin scrapings from the lesion are sent for KOH preparation and fungal culture. Microscopic examination shows the following image below and culture reveals white colonies with a reddish reverse side. What is the most likely organism causing this condition?

A 72-year-old male with a history of type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension is brought to the emergency department in a comatose state. On examination, his blood pressure is 165/95 mmHg, heart rate is 110 beats per minute, and plantar reflexes are bilaterally extensor. There is no focal neurological deficit. What is the most appropriate next step in management?
A 36-year-old female is posted for Modified radical mastectomy under general anesthesia. Halfway through the surgery, this is her capnograph. What should be the next step?

A 62-year-old male with a history of chronic atrial fibrillation is on warfarin for stroke prevention. During his regular follow-up, the patient's medication list is reviewed to optimize his warfarin therapy and avoid interactions that could affect its efficacy. Given the known drug interactions with warfarin, which of the following would not enhance the anticoagulant effect of warfarin?

A 42-year-old man undergoes a colectomy, and the pathologist identifies more than 100 polyps in the resected specimen along with a focus of invasive adenocarcinoma. Genetic testing reveals a mutation in a gene that regulates cell adhesion and growth. What is the functional mechanism of the gene mutation responsible for his condition?

A patient came with complaints of pain in the right calf for six months. The pain was mild, dull aching, worsened on prolonged standing and was relieved on rest. She also complained of multiple swellings on medial aspect of the right lower limb which had started initially in the foot and later progressed upwards till the calf. The patient is a bus conductor by occupation and an occasional smoker. What is the next step?

A 35-year-old gardener is found unresponsive after handling a plant as shown below. He is brought to the emergency department with bradycardia, hypotension, and severe arrhythmias. Despite treatment, he dies shortly after arrival. Which of the following plants is most likely responsible for his symptoms?

A global health organization is planning interventions to reduce the impact of diseases that cause early death and prolonged disability in low-income countries. To prioritize these interventions, they need to quantify the overall burden of disease in terms of both premature mortality and years lived with disability. Which of the following metrics should they use?

A 32-year-old pregnant woman at 18 weeks gestation undergoes routine prenatal screening. The quadruple screening test is performed to assess the risk of chromosomal abnormalities. Which of the following markers is not measured in the quadruple screening test?

A young lady after intense workout, lifting heavy weights, presents to you with a lower back ache involving right hip and radiating to right ankle. MRI shows the following finding. What nerve root is likely to get involved?

For a patient with type 2 diabetes needing enhanced insulin secretion post-meal, which medication would be appropriate to inhibit the enzyme that degrades incretin hormones, thereby prolonging their glucose-lowering effect?

A 32-year-old woman with a history of multiple transfusions due to recurrent anemia presents to the emergency department with fever and chills 3 hours after receiving a blood transfusion. She denies shortness of breath, chest pain, or dark-colored urine. Her vitals show a temperature of 38.5°C (101.3°F). Physical examination is unremarkable, and the transfusion was stopped promptly. Laboratory workup reveals no evidence of hemolysis. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient’s symptoms?

A clinical researcher is analyzing data from a study and calculates the confidence interval to estimate the range within which the true population parameter lies. Which of the following elements is typically included in the calculation of a confidence limit?
A public health team is preparing to launch a cross-sectional study on Type 2 diabetes in a medium-sized city. Which of the following is a correct statement?

options.label: A
options.text: It can estimate incidence of Diabetes

options.label: B
options.text: It can estimate prevalence of Diabetes

questions.correct_answer: B. It can estimate prevalence of Diabetes

questions.text: Inhibition of Dicer function would most likely affect which of the following processes?

A 40-year-old man is brought by police for a medicolegal examination after being struck multiple times with a lathi during a strike. On examination, several injuries are noted. Which of the following injuries would not typically be caused by a lathi? Fissured fracture Abrasion collar Incised looking lacerated wound Incised wound

A physician is considering various treatment options for a patient diagnosed with glaucoma, focusing specifically on medications that influence intraocular pressure by acting on the trabecular meshwork to affect aqueous humor outflow. Which of the following drugs specifically acts on the trabecular meshwork to facilitate increased aqueous outflow?

A 47-year-old woman with a history of chronic viral infection presents for routine follow-up. Laboratory results show persistently elevated levels of IgG against viral proteins. One of the mechanisms involved in the clearance of infected cells relies on antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (ADCC). Which of the following cells are involved in ADCC?
questions.correct_answer: C. NK cells, neutrophils, and eosinophils

questions.text: A 40-year-old male from a rural area presents with swelling in his legs, fever, and night sweats. On examination, he has pitting edema of both lower limbs. He mentions occasional episodes of fever with chills. A peripheral blood smear taken at night reveals thread-like organisms with a sheath and nuclei that do not extend to the tail tip. What is true about this worm?

options.label: A
options.text: The organism is monoecious and associated with parthenogenesis.

options.label: B
options.text: It is transmitted through the intake of contaminated food and water.

options.label: C
options.text: It is known to cause Löffler’s pneumonia.

options.label: D
options.text: Infection occurs via penetration of the skin by filariform larvae.

questions.correct_answer: D. Infection occurs via penetration of the skin by filariform larvae.

questions.text: Which of the following criteria is used for diagnosing an abdominal pregnancy?
Which of the following is not a measure of stroke volume?

options.label: A
options.text: Left ventricular end diastolic volume minus left ventricular end systolic volume

options.label: B
options.text: Ejection fraction times left ventricular end diastolic volume

questions.correct_answer: C. Ejection fraction times cardiac output
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Ejection fraction times cardiac output

questions.text: A 35-year-old female presents with complaints of worsening peripheral vision. An ophthalmologic examination shows loss of visual fields in the temporal region. An MRI of the brain is shown below. Laboratory investigations reveal the following hormone levels: Prolactin: 52 ng/mL (normal range: 4 to 23 ng/mL), ACTH: 9 pg/mL (normal range: 10 to 60 pg/mL), TSH: 0.1 mIU/mL (normal range: 0.4 to 4.0 mIU/mL), GH: 1 ng/mL (normal range: <5 ng/mL). What is the most likely diagnosis?
Identify the incorrect statement about the condition.

options.label: B
options.text: Surgical exploration is needed as early as possible

options.label: C
options.text: Occurs due to high investment of tunica vaginalis

options.label: D
options.text: Pain gets worse on elevating the testis

questions.correct_answer: A. Seen in elderly smoker men
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Seen in elderly smoker men

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman presents to the clinic complaining of foot pain and difficulty walking after wearing high heels for several days in a row. She reports that the pain is worse along the inner side of her foot and increases with standing or walking. On physical examination, tenderness is noted over the medial arch of the foot. X-rays show a slight flattening of the medial longitudinal arch. Which ligament is most likely injured?

A 50-year-old man undergoes rapid weight loss in preparation for an upcoming role in a film. Shortly after, he begins to experience occasional abdominal discomfort. A HIDA scan reveals slow and incomplete gallbladder emptying in response to cholecystokinin stimulation. Based on these findings, which of the following is the patient most likely to develop?
A 14-year-old male presented with a mushroom like tumour in the distal femur for the past 2 years. Which of the following features will help the clinician to identify a malignant transformation?

options.label: A
options.text: Initially growth of the tumour was away from the joint, now tumour growth is towards the joint

options.label: B
options.text: Hyaline cap thickness on MRI is 2 cm

options.label: C
options.text: Tumour does not have malignant transformation

options.label: D
options.text: Tumour is in continuation with bone marrow cavity of the normal bone

questions.correct_answer: B. Hyaline cap thickness on MRI is 2 cm

questions.text: A 47-year-old man undergoing treatment for Hodgkin's lymphoma develops skin changes, as shown in the image, during a routine follow-up visit. He has no prior history of skin conditions. Which drug in his treatment plan is most likely responsible for this skin manifestation?

A 16-year-old girl presents to the clinic with primary amenorrhea. She reports no breast development but has not experienced menarche. Physical examination reveals normal external female genitalia and normal breast development (Tanner stage 1). On pelvic ultrasound, the uterus is present but the ovaries are not visualized. Karyotype analysis is given below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
During a medical ethics seminar, a discussion focuses on the Declaration of Lisbon. What is the main subject of the Declaration of Lisbon as it pertains to healthcare?

A 45-year-old agricultural worker presents with symptoms of pesticide poisoning. The healthcare provider suspects exposure to an organophosphate compound. Which of the following is not classified as an organophosphate?

A 54-year-old male underwent a parotidectomy for a benign parotid tumor. After the surgery, he noticed an inability to move the lower part of his lip on one side, causing difficulty when trying to smile or speak. This suggests an injury to a branch of the facial nerve. Which part of the facial nerve was most likely affected during the surgery, leading to his lower lip paralysis?
questions.correct_answer: D. Cervical branch of facial nerve

questions.text: A 40-year-old alcoholic male on regular NSAIDs for headache presents with sudden onset blood in vomit. On examination, his pulse is 110/min, BP 96/70 mm of Hg. He is not consuming any anticoagulant drugs. Abdominal examination is normal. After initial resuscitation, an endoscopy is done which reveals the following. What is the appropriate management of the given endoscopic finding?

A 28-year-old athlete presents for a routine check-up. He engages in intense sports for 6-7 hours a day and experiences coughing, dyspnea, and wheezing afterward. Despite using salbutamol, his symptoms persist. What is the most appropriate management for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Inhaled salbutamol 2 puffs to be continued

options.label: B
options.text: Inhaled corticosteroids once daily along with salbutamol

questions.correct_answer: B. Inhaled corticosteroids once daily along with salbutamol

questions.text: In a clinical trial assessing the efficacy of a new targeted therapy for metastatic melanoma, the survival data are analyzed using a Kaplan-Meier survival curve. Halfway through the study, some participants had to discontinue the treatment due to severe adverse effects, while others remained under observation without manifesting the primary endpoint of progression-free survival. How would the Kaplan-Meier survival curve handle these participants who discontinued treatment early?

options.label: A
options.text: Their data would be considered as events at the time of discontinuation.

options.label: B
options.text: They would be excluded from the survival analysis entirely.

options.label: C
options.text: Their data would be censored at the time of discontinuation.

options.label: D
options.text: They would be recorded as having complete data until the study ends.

questions.correct_answer: C. Their data would be censored at the time of discontinuation.

questions.text: A 28-year-old man presents with frequent falls, progressive difficulty walking, and worsening clumsiness over the past year. He also reports increasing fatigue and difficulty swallowing solid foods. His family history is notable for his brother having a similar condition. He met all developmental milestones during childhood but had multiple ear infections. On examination, he has an unsteady, wide-based gait, and foot deformities, including hammer toes and high arches. His serum glucose is 320 mg/dL. Further evaluation of this patient is most likely to show which of the following findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Mutation of type I collagen gene

questions.correct_answer: B. Expansion of GAA trinucleotide repeats

questions.text: A patient is brought to the hospital after an opioid overdose, and naloxone is administered. After initial improvement, the patient becomes drowsy and experiences respiratory depression again. What is the most likely explanation for this recurrence of symptoms?

options.label: C
options.text: Naloxone's shorter half-life compared to opioids

questions.correct_answer: C. Naloxone's shorter half-life compared to opioids
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Naloxone's shorter half-life compared to opioids

questions.text: A 29-year-old woman at 32 weeks of gestation is admitted to the hospital with preterm labor. The obstetric team plans to administer corticosteroids to enhance fetal lung maturity. What is the correct dosing regimen for dexamethasone in this scenario?

options.label: A
options.text: 2 doses of 6 mg given 12 hours apart

options.label: B
options.text: 4 doses of 6 mg given 12 hours apart

options.label: C
options.text: 4 doses of 12 mg given 12 hours apart

options.label: D
options.text: 2 doses of 12 mg given 24 hours apart

questions.correct_answer: B. 4 doses of 6 mg given 12 hours apart
questions.explanation: Ans. B) 4 doses of 6 mg given 12 hours apart

questions.text: A non-obese 50-year-old male presents with widespread skin changes similar to the condition shown in the image, along with rugose hypertrophy of the palmar skin (tripe palms). Which of the following associations is most likely?

A 32-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after being found unconscious in the mountains while attempting a deep meditation retreat. Upon examination, his vital signs are barely detectable, and he shows no spontaneous movement. Despite the appearance of death, physicians believe the patient is in a state resembling suspended animation. Which of the following statements regarding this condition is false?

options.label: A
options.text: The patient has a reduced metabolic rate.

options.label: B
options.text: The patient cannot be revived by resuscitation.

options.label: C
options.text: The oxygen requirement of individual cells is satisfied through dissolved oxygen in the blood.

options.label: D
options.text: A yogic person can voluntarily go in the state of suspended animation.

questions.correct_answer: B. The patient cannot be revived by resuscitation.

questions.text: A public health team is planning a community health survey and is reviewing various sampling techniques to ensure the sample is representative of the population. Which of the following is not a recognized sampling technique used in community health surveys?
A microbiology lab is evaluating various diagnostic methods for infectious diseases. Which of the following statements about xenodiagnosis techniques is false?

options.label: A
options.text: Blood from a suspected dengue patient can be used to cultivate the virus in Aedes mosquitoes.

options.label: B
options.text: The rabbit ileal loop assay is a diagnostic tool for Enterotoxigenic Escherichia coli (ETEC).

options.label: C
options.text: Coxiella is cultivated in eggs to synthesize antigens needed for antibody detection.

options.label: D
options.text: Sandflies can be cultured in hamster eggs.

questions.correct_answer: D. Sandflies can be cultured in hamster eggs.

questions.text: Find the false statement among the following regarding the development of the ear during gestation:

options.label: A
options.text: Development of the middle ear begins in the 3rd week of gestation and completes by the 30th week.

options.label: B
options.text: Development of the vestibular labyrinth begins in the 3rd week of gestation and completes by the 28th week.

options.label: C
options.text: Development of the pinna begins in the 6th week of gestation and completes by the 20th week.

options.label: D
options.text: Development of the cochlea begins in the 3rd week of gestation and completes by the 20th week.

questions.correct_answer: B. Development of the vestibular labyrinth begins in the 3rd week of gestation and completes by the 28th week.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Development of the vestibular labyrinth begins in the 3rd week of gestation and completes by the 28th week.

questions.text: A 67-year-old man presents with chronic fatigue, weight loss, and left-sided abdominal discomfort. Physical examination reveals non-tender axillary and inguinal lymphadenopathy, along with hepatosplenomegaly. Laboratory tests show hemoglobin of 13.5 g/dL, leukocyte count of 40,000/mm³ with lymphocytosis, and platelets of 97,000/mm³. A peripheral smear shows numerous mature lymphocytes and smudge cells. Flow cytometry confirms CD20+, CD5+, and CD23+ B cells. Which of the following findings is the strongest indicator of poor prognosis in this patient?

A 55-year-old man with a history of rheumatoid arthritis is being treated with long-term NSAID therapy. He presents to the clinic complaining of mild epigastric pain. To minimize his risk of developing duodenal ulcers, which prostaglandin analog should be prescribed to inhibit gastric acid secretion and enhance mucosal protection?
What is a woronoff ring associated with, in the context of psoriasis?

options.label: B
options.text: Excessive scratching and rubbing in psoriatic plaques.

questions.correct_answer: B. Excessive scratching and rubbing in psoriatic plaques.

questions.text: A 42-year-old male presents with abdominal discomfort and a history of intermittent intestinal obstruction. An abdominal CT scan shows compression of the third part of the duodenum between the abdominal aorta and the superior mesenteric artery. Which of the following is not an anterior relation of the third part of the duodenum?

options.label: C
options.text: Fundus and body of Gall bladder

questions.correct_answer: C. Fundus and body of Gall bladder

questions.text: Which reaction in the figure below occurs in both muscle and liver but has substantially different qualities in the two?

A 58-year-old male presents with progressive muscle weakness, fasciculations, and difficulty swallowing. Over the past few months, he has experienced increasing difficulty walking and frequent choking while eating. On physical examination, there is marked atrophy of the limb muscles, brisk deep tendon reflexes, and fasciculations in the tongue and upper extremities. There is no sensory loss. MRI of the brain and spinal cord is normal. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A healthcare provider is evaluating the effectiveness of a new diagnostic test for early-stage pancreatic cancer. The test has been reported to have a sensitivity of 85% and a specificity of 95%. In a population where the prevalence of early-stage pancreatic cancer is 5%, what is the probability that a person who tests positive actually has the disease?

A 25-year-old male presented with right groin swelling, located above the inguinal ligament, going all the way into the bottom of the scrotum. An expansile cough impulse was present. On occlusion of the deep ring, the swelling did not reappear. What is the type of hernia?

A 31-year-old G2P1 woman delivers a 4.2 kg baby via vaginal delivery. Following delivery, her uterus is atonic, and she develops heavy postpartum hemorrhage despite the administration of oxytocin and carboprost. Bimanual uterine compression and a balloon tamponade are attempted but failed to control the bleeding. She is taken to the operating room for an emergency laparotomy. What is the next best step in the surgical management of her hemorrhage?

A 45-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with a history of leg pain following prolonged exercise. On examination, there are no signs of vascular insufficiency, and the pain is localized to the lateral side of the leg. Neurovascular bundles are absent in which of the following compartments of the leg?

A 42-year-old man presents with a 2-week history of fever, weakness, and bleeding gums. Peripheral blood smear reveals pancytopenia, and a bone marrow biopsy shows 26% blasts with Auer rods and mature myeloid cells. Additionally, neutrophils with pseudo Pelger-Huet anomaly are detected. Which of the following cytochemical stains is most likely to be positive?

A 28-year-old man presents to the clinic with concerns about a lump in his neck that he noticed several weeks ago. His family history is notable for his mother having a tumor that led to severe hypertension. On physical examination, a firm, non-tender nodule is palpated in the anterior neck, and the patient has visible mucosal neuromas on his tongue and buccal mucosa. Laboratory results show an elevated serum calcitonin level. Genetic testing is being considered to identify the underlying mutation. Which of the following genes is most likely mutated in this patient?

A 3 days old baby’s mother came to the pediatric OPD. She is concerned that whenever she breastfeeds her baby, her baby sleeps comfortably but after every 30 minutes the baby wakes up and starts crying. On further evaluation, you find that the mother has been breastfeeding the baby correctly, however the baby feeds for just 5-10 minutes after which he goes to sleep. What could be the possible cause of frequent awakening in the baby?

options.label: A
options.text: Baby is crying because the diaper is wet

options.label: B
options.text: The quality of the mother’s feed is not good

options.label: C
options.text: Baby is getting only foremilk, the satiety value is missing

options.label: D
options.text: We should rule out neonatal sepsis

questions.correct_answer: C. Baby is getting only foremilk, the satiety value is missing
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Baby is getting only foremilk, the satiety value is missing

questions.text: A 52-year-old man presents with chest pain radiating to his left arm and shortness of breath for the past 6 hours. He has a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia. Physical examination reveals diaphoresis, hypotension, and an S4 heart sound. An ECG shows ST-segment elevations in the anterior leads, and serum troponins are elevated. He is treated with thrombolytic therapy. A biopsy of the heart tissue taken later as shown in the image below. Which of the following is the most likely mechanism responsible for the observed pathology in the image?

A 38-year-old woman presents with complaints of swelling in her legs and foamy urine for the past few weeks. She has no significant past medical history and no recent infections. A urinalysis reveals significant proteinuria. A renal biopsy is performed, and the immunofluorescence findings are shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

In assessing diagnostic tools for fungal infections, a physician reviews the utility of the 1, 3-beta-D-glucan assay. This test detects most invasive fungal infections except for which of the following?

A 13-year-old boy is evaluated for progressive vision loss, including night blindness and loss of peripheral vision. He also has myopia. Fundoscopic examination reveals gyrate atrophy of the choroid and retina. The patient has a family history of a similar disorder, and genetic testing confirms an autosomal recessive pattern of inheritance. This condition is most likely due to the deficiency of which of the following enzymes?
A 25-year-old patient has developed tuberculosis in which mycobacterium is resistant to rifampicin, isoniazid and levofloxacin. This tuberculosis is referred to as?

A mother brings her infant for routine vaccination. As you are an intern moving here and there, she noticed you and asked you about yourself. When you were talking the baby grasped a toy as shown in the image and tried to eat it. Her mother suddenly picked the toy and threw it. At which age does the following mature finger grasp develop?

A 32-year-old man and his partner present to an infertility clinic after trying to conceive for 1 year. A hysterosalpingogram of his partner is normal, but his semen analysis reveals azoospermia. Further evaluation is needed to differentiate between an obstructive and testicular cause of his azoospermia. What is the next best step in the diagnostic workup?

A clinician is considering pharmacological options for a patient diagnosed with non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH). The patient has significant liver fat accumulation and early signs of fibrosis. Which of the following drugs, known for its selective action on thyroid hormone receptor beta (THR-β) and its role in reducing liver fat and fibrosis, would be most appropriate for this patient?

A 1-year-old boy presents with chronic fatigue, pallor, and jaundice. Laboratory testing reveals anemia, with abnormally low levels of lactate production by his red blood cells. The low lactate level is confirmed using a radiolabeled substrate. A deficiency in which of the following enzymes is the most likely the cause of this patient’s anemia?

A 32-year-old female presents with vomiting, fever, and yellowing of the skin and sclera. Her last menstrual period was 10 weeks ago. Physical examination reveals right upper quadrant tenderness and hepatomegaly. Her temperature is 101.3 F ° . Laboratory results show total bilirubin of 4.5 mg/dL (conjugated bilirubin- 1.1 mg/dL, unconjugated bilirubin -3.4 mg/dL), alkaline phosphatase (ALP)- 150 U/L, AST- 1054 U/L, ALT -2187 U/L, and a positive pregnancy test. What is the most likely complication of this patient's condition?
